hanzi-su-wiki:
牲

Значения

Жертва

Мнемоника

Бык 牛, приносимый в жертву ради будущих жизней 生 — умножения семейства, стада и т.д.
purpleculture_pinyin:
shēng
domestic animal; sacrificial animal
домашнее животное; жертвенное животное
rtega_mnemonic:
牲牲RSsacrificial animal, livestock, animal
  • lively 生 cow 牛
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 生 indicates the sound; 牛 (ox) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
牺牲 [ xī shēng ]: to sacrifice one's life; to sacrifice (sth valued); beast slaughtered as a sacrifice
牲畜 [ shēng chù ]: domesticated animals; livestock
牺牲品 [ xī shēng pǐn ]: sacrificial victim; sb who is expendable; item sold at a loss
宰牲节 [ zǎi shēng jié ]: see 古尔邦节
畜牲 [ chù shēng ]: variant of 畜生
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 牛 [ niú ] ox, cow, bull
    • 生 [ shēng ] life, lifetime; birth; growth
heisig_chinese_memo: The life of most cows is to be a domestic animal, not running free in the forest.
heisig_constituent: animal sacrifice, cow, life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up
koohiiStory1: Animal sacrifice = taking the life of a cow.
koohiiStory2: In the 21st century, animal sacrifice is no longer really necessary. We can take a single cell from a cow, with no harm to the cow. We create a viable cell line from this single cell, and feed the resulting biomatter into a furnace at the exact rate necessary to appease the gods.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you take a cow's life you're turning it into an offering. In the old days, cows' lives were given to the gods as offerings pretty often.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture yourself offering the cow's life up to the god(s). It's a good thing we don't actually have to do this anymore, you think.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You prepare the offering with your holy blue saber (せい). Normally this would be gruesome, but your saber glows and the cow's life shoots up into the sky without you laying a hand on it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Thanks to the mercy of your saber, the offering is quick and painless. A normal saber, however, would have cut that cow to bits. Like, really just wrecked it. Good thing we didn't make you think about that, huh?
Ru_trainchinese: shēng: (графема) домашние животные, сила которых используется для ведения хозяйства; например, лошади, волы
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a cow's (牜) life (生) is sacrificed
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The life of most cows is to be a domestic animal, not running free in the forest.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The inscription from " ox ", the sound of " birth " indicates the livestock used for sacrifice. Inscriptions on gold mean sacrifices to animals, mainly cattle, sheep, and hogs. Sui Ling Fang Zun: "Ming used sacrifices in the Beijing Palace." "Zhou Yi. "Cui": "Use big sacrifices, good luck."

Later refers to the whole cow used for sacrifice in ancient times. "Shuowen": "Animals, cattle are complete. From cattle produce sounds." Duan Yucai's note: "Extension is the nest of mortal animals. "Zhou Li. The people" Note: "The first raising is called the animal, and the one that will be used is called the animal. 』」
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from " cow ", the sound of " birth " means livestock used for sacrifice.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「牛」，「生」聲，表示祭祀用的牲畜。金文表示祭牲，主要為牛、羊、豕。夨令方尊：「明公用牲于京宮。」《周易．萃》：「用大牲，吉。」

　　後指古代供祭祀用的全牛。《說文》：「牲，牛完全。从牛生聲。」段玉裁注：「引伸爲凡畜之偁。《周禮．庖人》注：『始養之曰畜，将用之曰牲。』」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「牛」，「生」聲，表示祭祀用的牲畜。

Elaboration: The inscription from " ox", the sound of " birth" indicates the livestock used for sacrifice. Inscriptions on gold mean sacrifices to animals, mainly cattle, sheep, and hogs. Sui Ling Fang Zun: "Ming used sacrifices in the Beijing Palace." "Zhou Yi. "Cui": "Use big sacrifices, good luck." Later refers to the whole cow used for sacrifice in ancient times. "Shuowen": "Animals, cattle are complete. From cattle produce sounds." Duan Yucai's note: "Extension is the nest of mortal animals. "Zhou Li. The people" Note: "The first raising is called the animal, and the one that will be used is called the animal. 』」

牲字的基本解释

牲
shēng
家畜：牲口。牲灵。牲畜。
古代特指供宴飨祭祀用的牛、羊、猪：三牲。献牲。

牲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shēng］
［《廣韻》所庚切，平庚，生。］
(1)供祭祀、盟誓和食用的家畜。
(2)谓用牺牲献祭。

牲字的英文翻译

◎ 牲
animal sacrifice, domestic animal

牲字的康熙字典解释

【巳集下】【牛字部】　牲； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页700第03
【唐韻】所庚切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】師庚切，?音生。【說文】牛全完。从牛，生聲。【易·萃卦】用大牲吉。【書·微子】今殷民乃攘竊神祇之犧牷牲用。【傳】色純白曰犧，體完曰牷，牛羊豕曰牲，器實曰用。【疏】經傳多言三牲，知牲是牛羊豕也。【周禮·天官·膳夫】膳用六牲。【註】馬牛羊豕犬雞也。又【庖人註】六畜，六牲也。始養之曰畜，將用之曰牲。【春秋·僖三十一年】四卜郊，不從，乃免牲。【左傳】牛卜日曰牲。【註】旣得吉日，則牛改名曰牲。　又叶倉經切。【班固·東都賦】薦三犧，效五牲。禮神祇，懷百靈。◎按周禮秋官典客云：上公牲三十有六。註云：牲當爲腥，聲之誤也。釋文依註音星，蓋周禮本當作腥，誤作牲。鄭註明言其誤。正韻引此，另音星，非是。

考證：〔【班固·東都賦】薦三犧，效五牲。體神祇，懷百靈。〕　謹照原文體改禮。
牲字的源字形

牲字的起名意思

古代供祭祀用的全牛。

[Siji 2] [Bull Character Department] 　Sacrifice; Kangxi strokes: 9; Page number: page 700 03
【Tang Yun】Suo Gengqie 【Jiyun】【Yunhui】【Zhengyun】Teacher Gengqie, sound student. [Said the text] Niu is all over. From the cow, make a sound. 【Easy·Cui Gua】Use a great sacrifice. [Book·Weizi] Today, Yinmin is used as a sacrifice for thief gods. [Biography] The color is pure and white is called sacrifice, the body is finished is called 牷, the cattle, sheep, and hogs are called sacrifice, and the actual utensils are called use. 【Sparse】It has been said that there are three kinds of sacrifices, and it is known that the sacrifices are cattle, sheep and hogs. 【Zhou Li·Tian Guan·Sinfu】Six sacrifices for meals. [Note] Horses, cattle, sheep, hogs, dogs, and chickens. Also【庖人Note】Six animals, six animals. The first to raise is called animal, and the one to be used is called animal. [Spring and Autumn·Thirty-one Years] In the four suburbs of Buddhism, if you fail to comply, you will be exempted from sacrifices. [Legend of Zuo] Niu Buri said as a sacrifice. [Note] If you get lucky, the cow will be renamed as Sacrifice.　 Ye Cang Sutra cut again. 【Bangu·Dongdu Fu】Recommend three sacrifices and serve five sacrifices. Respect God, conceive Bailing. ◎According to Zhou Liqiu's official code, the guest said: There are six out of thirty for the public sacrifice. Note: Animals are regarded as fishy, and the sound is wrong. The interpretation of the text is based on the phonetic star, and the Zhou ritual is regarded as a fishy, and it is mistaken as a sacrifice. Zheng noted that it was wrong. Sacrifice
Source glyph
Sacrifice
Name meaning
A whole cow used for sacrificial offerings in ancient times.
牲 sheng
“牲”的本义是“供祭祀用的全
牛”。“生”是声旁。由于甲骨文中兽
畜类的形旁往往可以互换,现见最早
的字形从“羊”;金文以后才固定为
“牛”。后泛指供祭祀和食用的各种
家畜。
草
书
(同楷书)
甲骨文
金文
我
书
书
行
简化字
科料料牲牲
Шэн
Первоначальное значение слова «жертва» - «целая корова для жертвоприношения».
«Шэн» в стороне.
Поскольку формы животных и животных в надписях на костях оракула часто взаимозаменяемы, самые ранние глифы обозначаются словом «овца»; надписи на костях и костях впоследствии фиксируются как «крупный рогатый скот».
Позже это относится ко всем видам домашнего скота для жертвоприношений и еды.
я
Упрощенные символы
Животные
shēng
сущ.
1) животное; домашний скот
2)* жертвенное животное; жертвенный
牲用 жертвенное животное и ритуальная утварь
牲宰 закалывать жертвенное животное
Radicals: 牛, 生  (cow, life)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you take a cow's life you're turning it into an offering. In the old days, cows' lives were given to the gods as offerings pretty often.
Picture yourself offering the cow's life up to the god(s). It's a good thing we don't actually have to do this anymore, you think.
Reading Mnemonic
You prepare the offering with your holy blue saber (せい). Normally this would be gruesome, but your saber glows and the cow's life shoots up into the sky without you laying a hand on it.
Thanks to the mercy of your saber, the offering is quick and painless. A normal saber, however, would have cut that cow to bits. Like, really just wrecked it. Good thing we didn't make you think about that, huh?
